segment.source: Troubleshoot Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Troubleshoot Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: Troubleshoot common problems, including setup issues, Exchange ActiveSync errors.
segment.target: Troubleshoot common problems, including setup issues, Exchange ActiveSync errors.

segment.source: Troubleshoot Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Troubleshoot Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: Troubleshoot common problems, including setup issues, Exchange ActiveSync errors.
segment.target: Troubleshoot common problems, including setup issues, Exchange ActiveSync errors.

segment.source: Common issues are listed in the following table, along with causes and possible fixes.
segment.target: Common issues are listed in the following table, along with causes and possible fixes.

segment.source: The Setup troubleshooting section contains a listing of on-device problems, along with several types of issues that may be encountered during the first-run experience.
segment.target: The Setup troubleshooting section contains a listing of on-device problems, along with several types of issues that may be encountered during the first-run experience.

segment.source: The Exchange ActiveSync errors section lists common errors the device may encounter when trying to synchronize with an Microsoft Exchange ActiveSync server.
segment.target: The Exchange ActiveSync errors section lists common errors the device may encounter when trying to synchronize with an Microsoft Exchange ActiveSync server.

segment.source: Setup troubleshooting
segment.target: Setup troubleshooting

segment.source: Exchange ActiveSync errors
segment.target: Exchange ActiveSync errors

segment.source: Setup troubleshooting
segment.target: Setup troubleshooting

segment.source: This section lists causes, and possible fixes to help troubleshoot issues you might find when you set up your Microsoft Surface Hub.
segment.target: This section lists causes, and possible fixes to help troubleshoot issues you might find when you set up your Microsoft Surface Hub.

segment.source: On-device
segment.target: On-device

segment.source: Possible fixes for issues on the Surface Hub after you've completed the first-run program.
segment.target: Possible fixes for issues on the Surface Hub after you've completed the first-run program.

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: Not receiving automatic accept/decline messages.
segment.target: Not receiving automatic accept/decline messages.

segment.source: The device account isn't configured to automatically accept/decline messages.
segment.target: The device account isn't configured to automatically accept/decline messages.

segment.source: Use PowerShell cmdlet .
segment.target: Use PowerShell cmdlet .

segment.source: The device account isn't configured to process external meeting requests.
segment.target: The device account isn't configured to process external meeting requests.

segment.source: Use PowerShell cmdlet .
segment.target: Use PowerShell cmdlet .

segment.source: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen, or message "Appointments of date (no account provisioned)" is being displayed.
segment.target: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen, or message "Appointments of date (no account provisioned)" is being displayed.

segment.source: No device account is set up on this Surface Hub.
segment.target: No device account is set up on this Surface Hub.

segment.source: Provision a device account through Settings.
segment.target: Provision a device account through Settings.

segment.source: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments of date (overprovisioned)" is being displayed.
segment.target: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments of date (overprovisioned)" is being displayed.

segment.source: The device account is provisioned on too many devices.
segment.target: The device account is provisioned on too many devices.

segment.source: Remove the device account from other devices that it's provisioned to.
segment.target: Remove the device account from other devices that it's provisioned to.

segment.source: This can be done using the Exchange admin portal.
segment.target: This can be done using the Exchange admin portal.

segment.source: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments of date (invalid credentials)" is being displayed.
segment.target: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments of date (invalid credentials)" is being displayed.

segment.source: The device account's password has expired and is no longer valid.
segment.target: The device account's password has expired and is no longer valid.

segment.source: Update the account's password in Settings.
segment.target: Update the account's password in Settings.

segment.source: Also see Password management.
segment.target: Also see Password management.

segment.source: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments of date (account policy)" is being displayed.
segment.target: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments of date (account policy)" is being displayed.

segment.source: The device account is using an invalid ActiveSync policy.
segment.target: The device account is using an invalid ActiveSync policy.

segment.source: Make sure the device account has an ActiveSync policy where .
segment.target: Make sure the device account has an ActiveSync policy where .

segment.source: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments may be out of date" is being displayed.
segment.target: Calendar is not showing on the Welcome screen or message "Appointments may be out of date" is being displayed.

segment.source: Exchange is not enabled.
segment.target: Exchange is not enabled.

segment.source: Enable the device account for Exchange services through Settings.
segment.target: Enable the device account for Exchange services through Settings.

segment.source: You need to make sure you have the right set of ActiveSync policies and have also installed any necessary certificates for Exchange services to work.
segment.target: You need to make sure you have the right set of ActiveSync policies and have also installed any necessary certificates for Exchange services to work.

segment.source: Can't log in to Skype for Business.
segment.target: Can't log in to Skype for Business.

segment.source: The device account does not have a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) address property.
segment.target: The device account does not have a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) address property.

segment.source: The account does not have a SIP address property and its User Principal Name (UPN) does not match the actual SIP address.
segment.target: The account does not have a SIP address property and its User Principal Name (UPN) does not match the actual SIP address.

segment.source: The account must have its SIP address set, or the SIP address should be added using the Settings app.
segment.target: The account must have its SIP address set, or the SIP address should be added using the Settings app.

segment.source: Can't log in to Skype for Business.
segment.target: Can't log in to Skype for Business.

segment.source: The device account requires a certificate to authenticate into Skype for Business.
segment.target: The device account requires a certificate to authenticate into Skype for Business.

segment.source: Install the appropriate certificate using provisioning packages.
segment.target: Install the appropriate certificate using provisioning packages.

segment.source: First run
segment.target: First run

segment.source: Possible fixes for issues with Surface Hub first-run program.
segment.target: Possible fixes for issues with Surface Hub first-run program.

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: Cannot find account when asked for domain and user name.
segment.target: Cannot find account when asked for domain and user name.

segment.source: Domain needs to be the fully qualified domain name (FQDN).
segment.target: Domain needs to be the fully qualified domain name (FQDN).

segment.source: The FQDN should be provided in the domain field.
segment.target: The FQDN should be provided in the domain field.

segment.source: Device account page, issues for new account settings
segment.target: Device account page, issues for new account settings

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: Unable to find the provided account in Azure AD.
segment.target: Unable to find the provided account in Azure AD.

segment.source: The provided account's User Principal Name (UPN) has a tenant that can't be reached in Azure AD.
segment.target: The provided account's User Principal Name (UPN) has a tenant that can't be reached in Azure AD.

segment.source: Make sure that you have a working Internet connection, and that the device can reach Microsoft Online Services.
segment.target: Make sure that you have a working Internet connection, and that the device can reach Microsoft Online Services.

segment.source: Make sure the account credentials are entered correctly.
segment.target: Make sure the account credentials are entered correctly.

segment.source: Unable to reach the specified directory.
segment.target: Unable to reach the specified directory.

segment.source: The provided account domain specifies a domain that can't be reached.
segment.target: The provided account domain specifies a domain that can't be reached.

segment.source: Make sure that you have a working network connection, and that the device can reach the domain controller.
segment.target: Make sure that you have a working network connection, and that the device can reach the domain controller.

segment.source: Make sure the account credentials are entered correctly.
segment.target: Make sure the account credentials are entered correctly.

segment.source: You can also try using the FQDN instead.
segment.target: You can also try using the FQDN instead.

segment.source: Can't auto-discover Exchange server.
segment.target: Can't auto-discover Exchange server.

segment.source: The Exchange server isn't configured for auto-discovery.
segment.target: The Exchange server isn't configured for auto-discovery.

segment.source: Enable auto-discovery of the Exchange server for the device account, or enter the account's Exchange server address manually.
segment.target: Enable auto-discovery of the Exchange server for the device account, or enter the account's Exchange server address manually.

segment.source: Could not discover the SIP address after entering the account credentials.
segment.target: Could not discover the SIP address after entering the account credentials.

segment.source: There was no SIP address entry in Active Directory or Azure AD.
segment.target: There was no SIP address entry in Active Directory or Azure AD.

segment.source: Make sure the account is enabled with Skype for Business and has a SIP address.
segment.target: Make sure the account is enabled with Skype for Business and has a SIP address.

segment.source: If not, you can enter the SIP address manually into the text box.
segment.target: If not, you can enter the SIP address manually into the text box.

segment.source: Device account page, issues for existing account settings
segment.target: Device account page, issues for existing account settings

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Error codes
segment.target: Error codes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: Account could not authenticate with the specified credentials.
segment.target: Account could not authenticate with the specified credentials.

segment.source: The account is not enabled as a user in Active Directory (AD), needs a password to authenticate, or the password is incorrect.
segment.target: The account is not enabled as a user in Active Directory (AD), needs a password to authenticate, or the password is incorrect.

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Make sure the credentials are entered correctly.
segment.target: Make sure the credentials are entered correctly.

segment.source: Enable the account as a user in AD and add a password, or set the RoomMailboxPassword
segment.target: Enable the account as a user in AD and add a password, or set the RoomMailboxPassword

segment.source: Error 0x800C0019 is displayed when providing an Exchange server.
segment.target: Error 0x800C0019 is displayed when providing an Exchange server.

segment.source: The device account requires a certificate to authenticate.
segment.target: The device account requires a certificate to authenticate.

segment.source: Install the appropriate certificate using provisioning packages.
segment.target: Install the appropriate certificate using provisioning packages.

segment.source: Device account credentials are not valid for the provided Exchange server.
segment.target: Device account credentials are not valid for the provided Exchange server.

segment.source: The provided Exchange server is not where the device account's mailbox is hosted.
segment.target: The provided Exchange server is not where the device account's mailbox is hosted.

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Make sure you are providing the correct Exchange mail server for the device account.
segment.target: Make sure you are providing the correct Exchange mail server for the device account.

segment.source: HTTP timeout while trying to reach Exchange server.
segment.target: HTTP timeout while trying to reach Exchange server.

segment.source: Couldn't find the provided Exchange server.
segment.target: Couldn't find the provided Exchange server.

segment.source: The Exchange server provided could not be found.
segment.target: The Exchange server provided could not be found.

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Ensure that you have a working network or Internet connection, and that the Exchange server you provided is correct.
segment.target: Ensure that you have a working network or Internet connection, and that the Exchange server you provided is correct.

segment.source: http not supported.
segment.target: http not supported.

segment.source: An Exchange server with http:// instead of https:// was provided.
segment.target: An Exchange server with http:// instead of https:// was provided.

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Use an Exchange server that uses https.
segment.target: Use an Exchange server that uses https.

segment.source: People land on the page titled "There's a problem with this account" regarding ActiveSync.
segment.target: People land on the page titled "There's a problem with this account" regarding ActiveSync.

segment.source: The ActiveSync policy PasswordEnabled is set to True (or 1).
segment.target: The ActiveSync policy PasswordEnabled is set to True (or 1).

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Create a new ActiveSync policy where PasswordEnabled is set to False (or 0), and then apply that policy to the account.
segment.target: Create a new ActiveSync policy where PasswordEnabled is set to False (or 0), and then apply that policy to the account.

segment.source: The Surface Hub doesn't have a connection to Exchange.
segment.target: The Surface Hub doesn't have a connection to Exchange.

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Make sure that you have a working network or Internet connection.
segment.target: Make sure that you have a working network or Internet connection.

segment.source: Exchange returns a status code indicating an error.
segment.target: Exchange returns a status code indicating an error.

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Make sure that you have a working network or Internet connection.
segment.target: Make sure that you have a working network or Internet connection.

segment.source: First run, Domain join page issues
segment.target: First run, Domain join page issues

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: When trying to join a domain, an error shows that the account couldn't authenticate using the specified credentials.
segment.target: When trying to join a domain, an error shows that the account couldn't authenticate using the specified credentials.

segment.source: The credentials provided are not capable of joining the specified domain.
segment.target: The credentials provided are not capable of joining the specified domain.

segment.source: Enter correct credentials for an account that exists in the specified domain.
segment.target: Enter correct credentials for an account that exists in the specified domain.

segment.source: When specifying a group from a domain, an error shows that the group couldn't be found on the domain.
segment.target: When specifying a group from a domain, an error shows that the group couldn't be found on the domain.

segment.source: The group may have been removed or no longer exists.
segment.target: The group may have been removed or no longer exists.

segment.source: Verify that the group exists within the domain.
segment.target: Verify that the group exists within the domain.

segment.source: First run, Exchange server page
segment.target: First run, Exchange server page

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: People land on this page and are asked for the Exchange server address.
segment.target: People land on this page and are asked for the Exchange server address.

segment.source: The Exchange server isn't configured for auto-discovery.
segment.target: The Exchange server isn't configured for auto-discovery.

segment.source: Enable auto-discovery of the Exchange server for the device account, or enter the account's Exchange server address manually.
segment.target: Enable auto-discovery of the Exchange server for the device account, or enter the account's Exchange server address manually.

segment.source: First run, On-device issues
segment.target: First run, On-device issues

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Error codes
segment.target: Error codes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: Can't sync mail/calendar.
segment.target: Can't sync mail/calendar.

segment.source: The account has not allowed the Surface Hub as an allowed device.
segment.target: The account has not allowed the Surface Hub as an allowed device.

segment.source: Add the Surface Hub device ID to the whitelist by setting the ActiveSyncAllowedDeviceIds property for the mailbox.
segment.target: Add the Surface Hub device ID to the whitelist by setting the ActiveSyncAllowedDeviceIds property for the mailbox.

segment.source: Skype for Business
segment.target: Skype for Business

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Causes
segment.target: Causes

segment.source: Possible fixes
segment.target: Possible fixes

segment.source: Can't call a Skype consumer from my Surface Hub.
segment.target: Can't call a Skype consumer from my Surface Hub.

segment.source: Outgoing calls aren't supported yet.
segment.target: Outgoing calls aren't supported yet.

segment.source: None currently.
segment.target: None currently.

segment.source: Exchange ActiveSync errors
segment.target: Exchange ActiveSync errors

segment.source: This section lists status codes, mapping, user messages, and actions an admin can take to solve Exchange ActiveSync errors.
segment.target: This section lists status codes, mapping, user messages, and actions an admin can take to solve Exchange ActiveSync errors.

segment.source: Hex Code
segment.target: Hex Code

segment.source: Mapping
segment.target: Mapping

segment.source: User-Friendly Message
segment.target: User-Friendly Message

segment.source: Action admin should take
segment.target: Action admin should take

segment.source: E_HTTP_DENIED
segment.target: E_HTTP_DENIED

segment.source: The password must be updated.
segment.target: The password must be updated.

segment.source: Update the password.
segment.target: Update the password.

segment.source: 0x80072EFD
segment.target: 0x80072EFD

segment.source: WININET_E_CANNOT_CONNECT
segment.target: WININET_E_CANNOT_CONNECT

segment.source: Can’t connect to the server right now.
segment.target: Can’t connect to the server right now.

segment.source: Wait a while and try again, or check the account settings.
segment.target: Wait a while and try again, or check the account settings.

segment.source: Verify that the server name is correct and reachable.
segment.target: Verify that the server name is correct and reachable.

segment.source: Verify that the device is connected to the network.
segment.target: Verify that the device is connected to the network.

segment.source: E_NEXUS_STATUS_DEVICE_NOTPROVISIONED (policies don’t match)
segment.target: E_NEXUS_STATUS_DEVICE_NOTPROVISIONED (policies don’t match)

segment.source: The account is configured with policies not compatible with Surface Hub.
segment.target: The account is configured with policies not compatible with Surface Hub.

segment.source: Disable the PasswordEnabled policy for this account.
segment.target: Disable the PasswordEnabled policy for this account.

segment.source: We have a bug were we may surface policy errors if the account doesn’t receive any server notifications within the policy refresh interval.
segment.target: We have a bug were we may surface policy errors if the account doesn’t receive any server notifications within the policy refresh interval.

segment.source: E_NEXUS_STATUS_MAXIMUMDEVICESREACHED
segment.target: E_NEXUS_STATUS_MAXIMUMDEVICESREACHED

segment.source: The account has too many device partnerships.
segment.target: The account has too many device partnerships.

segment.source: Delete one or more partnerships on the server.
segment.target: Delete one or more partnerships on the server.

segment.source: E_NEXUS_STATUS_SERVERERROR_RETRYLATER
segment.target: E_NEXUS_STATUS_SERVERERROR_RETRYLATER

segment.source: Can’t connect to the server right now.
segment.target: Can’t connect to the server right now.

segment.source: Wait until the server comes back online.
segment.target: Wait until the server comes back online.

segment.source: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.
segment.target: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.

segment.source: E_CREDENTIALS_EXPIRED (Credentials have expired and need to be updated)
segment.target: E_CREDENTIALS_EXPIRED (Credentials have expired and need to be updated)

segment.source: The password must be updated.
segment.target: The password must be updated.

segment.source: Update the password.
segment.target: Update the password.

segment.source: E_AIRSYNC_RESET_RETRY
segment.target: E_AIRSYNC_RESET_RETRY

segment.source: Can’t connect to the server right now.
segment.target: Can’t connect to the server right now.

segment.source: Wait a while or check the account’s settings.
segment.target: Wait a while or check the account’s settings.

segment.source: This is normally a transient error but if the issue persists check the number of devices associated with the account and delete some of them if the number is large.
segment.target: This is normally a transient error but if the issue persists check the number of devices associated with the account and delete some of them if the number is large.

segment.source: E_NEXUS_STATUS_USER_HASNOMAILBOX
segment.target: E_NEXUS_STATUS_USER_HASNOMAILBOX

segment.source: The mailbox was migrated to a different server.
segment.target: The mailbox was migrated to a different server.

segment.source: You should never see this error.
segment.target: You should never see this error.

segment.source: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.
segment.target: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.

segment.source: E_HTTP_FORBIDDEN
segment.target: E_HTTP_FORBIDDEN

segment.source: Can’t connect to the server right now.
segment.target: Can’t connect to the server right now.

segment.source: Wait a while and try again, or check the account’s settings.
segment.target: Wait a while and try again, or check the account’s settings.

segment.source: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.
segment.target: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.

segment.source: If the account is using cert based authentication make sure the certificate is still valid and update it if not.
segment.target: If the account is using cert based authentication make sure the certificate is still valid and update it if not.

segment.source: E_ACTIVESYNC_PASSWORD_OR_GETCERT
segment.target: E_ACTIVESYNC_PASSWORD_OR_GETCERT

segment.source: The account’s password or client certificate are missing or invalid.
segment.target: The account’s password or client certificate are missing or invalid.

segment.source: Update the password and/or deploy the client certificate.
segment.target: Update the password and/or deploy the client certificate.

segment.source: E_NEXUS_STATUS_DEVICE_POLICYREFRESH
segment.target: E_NEXUS_STATUS_DEVICE_POLICYREFRESH

segment.source: The account is configured with policies not compatible with Surface Hub.
segment.target: The account is configured with policies not compatible with Surface Hub.

segment.source: Disable the PasswordEnabled policy for this account.
segment.target: Disable the PasswordEnabled policy for this account.

segment.source: E_CREDENTIALS_UNAVAILABLE
segment.target: E_CREDENTIALS_UNAVAILABLE

segment.source: The password must be updated.
segment.target: The password must be updated.

segment.source: Update the password.
segment.target: Update the password.

segment.source: WININET_E_TIMEOUT
segment.target: WININET_E_TIMEOUT

segment.source: The network doesn’t support the minimum idle timeout required to receive server notification, or the server is offline.
segment.target: The network doesn’t support the minimum idle timeout required to receive server notification, or the server is offline.

segment.source: Verify that the server is running.
segment.target: Verify that the server is running.

segment.source: Verify the NAT settings.
segment.target: Verify the NAT settings.

segment.source: E_FAIL_ABORT
segment.target: E_FAIL_ABORT

segment.source: This error is used to interrupt the hanging sync, and will not be exposed to users.
segment.target: This error is used to interrupt the hanging sync, and will not be exposed to users.

segment.source: It will be shown in the telemetry if you force an interactive sync, delete the account, or update its settings.
segment.target: It will be shown in the telemetry if you force an interactive sync, delete the account, or update its settings.

segment.source: Nothing.
segment.target: Nothing.

segment.source: E_HTTP_SERVICE_UNAVAIL
segment.target: E_HTTP_SERVICE_UNAVAIL

segment.source: Can’t connect to the server right now.
segment.target: Can’t connect to the server right now.

segment.source: Wait a while or check the account’s settings.
segment.target: Wait a while or check the account’s settings.

segment.source: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.
segment.target: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.

segment.source: Wait until the server comes back online.
segment.target: Wait until the server comes back online.

segment.source: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.
segment.target: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.

segment.source: E_NEXUS_STATUS_MAILBOX_SERVEROFFLINE
segment.target: E_NEXUS_STATUS_MAILBOX_SERVEROFFLINE

segment.source: Can’t connect to the server right now.
segment.target: Can’t connect to the server right now.

segment.source: Wait a while or check the account’s settings.
segment.target: Wait a while or check the account’s settings.

segment.source: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.
segment.target: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.

segment.source: Wait until the server comes back online.
segment.target: Wait until the server comes back online.

segment.source: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.
segment.target: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.

segment.source: E_ACTIVESYNC_GETCERT
segment.target: E_ACTIVESYNC_GETCERT

segment.source: The Exchange server requires a certificate.
segment.target: The Exchange server requires a certificate.

segment.source: Import the appropriate EAS certificate on the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Import the appropriate EAS certificate on the Surface Hub.

segment.source: E_NEXUS_STATUS_INVALID_POLICYKEY
segment.target: E_NEXUS_STATUS_INVALID_POLICYKEY

segment.source: The account is configured with policies not compatible with Surface Hub.
segment.target: The account is configured with policies not compatible with Surface Hub.

segment.source: Disable the PasswordEnabled policy for this account.
segment.target: Disable the PasswordEnabled policy for this account.

segment.source: We have a bug were we may surface policy errors if the account doesn’t receive any server notifications within the policy refresh interval.
segment.target: We have a bug were we may surface policy errors if the account doesn’t receive any server notifications within the policy refresh interval.

segment.source: E_HTTP_NOT_FOUND
segment.target: E_HTTP_NOT_FOUND

segment.source: The server name is invalid.
segment.target: The server name is invalid.

segment.source: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.
segment.target: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.

segment.source: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.
segment.target: If the issue persists, re-provision the account.

segment.source: E_HTTP_SERVER_ERROR
segment.target: E_HTTP_SERVER_ERROR

segment.source: Can’t connect to the server.
segment.target: Can’t connect to the server.

segment.source: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.
segment.target: Verify the server name to make sure it is correct.

segment.source: Trigger a sync and, if the issue persists, re-provision the account.
segment.target: Trigger a sync and, if the issue persists, re-provision the account.

segment.source: WININET_E_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED
segment.target: WININET_E_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED

segment.source: The server name or address could not be resolved.
segment.target: The server name or address could not be resolved.

segment.source: Make sure the server name is entered correctly.
segment.target: Make sure the server name is entered correctly.

segment.source: ERROR_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION
segment.target: ERROR_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION

segment.source: While auto-discovering the Exchange server, a policy is applied that prevents the logged-in user from logging in to the server.
segment.target: While auto-discovering the Exchange server, a policy is applied that prevents the logged-in user from logging in to the server.

segment.source: This is a timing issue.
segment.target: This is a timing issue.

segment.source: Re-verify the account's credentials.
segment.target: Re-verify the account's credentials.

segment.source: Try to re-provision when they're correct.
segment.target: Try to re-provision when they're correct.

segment.source: INET_E_INVALID_CERTIFICATE
segment.target: INET_E_INVALID_CERTIFICATE

segment.source: Security certificate required to access this resource is invalid.
segment.target: Security certificate required to access this resource is invalid.

segment.source: Install the correct ActiveSync certificate needed for the provided device account.
segment.target: Install the correct ActiveSync certificate needed for the provided device account.

segment.source: WININET_E_INVALID_CA
segment.target: WININET_E_INVALID_CA

segment.source: The certificate authority is invalid or is incorrect.
segment.target: The certificate authority is invalid or is incorrect.

segment.source: Could not auto-discover the Exchange server because a certificate is missing.
segment.target: Could not auto-discover the Exchange server because a certificate is missing.

segment.source: Install the correct ActiveSync certificate needed for the provided device account.
segment.target: Install the correct ActiveSync certificate needed for the provided device account.

segment.source: E_FAIL
segment.target: E_FAIL

segment.source: The domain provided couldn't be found.
segment.target: The domain provided couldn't be found.

segment.source: The Exchange server could not be auto-discovered and was not provided in the settings.
segment.target: The Exchange server could not be auto-discovered and was not provided in the settings.

segment.source: Make sure that the domain entered is the FQDN, and that there is an Exchange server entered in the Exchange server text box.
segment.target: Make sure that the domain entered is the FQDN, and that there is an Exchange server entered in the Exchange server text box.
